00057 /*
00058 *To create the cross-section of the tool, take a 3d model of it
00059 * and project onto a plane normal to the motion vector.
00060 *Cross section would be useful for linear moves, instantaneous
00061 * outline computation for helical moves in any plane, and arc 
00062 * moves in xz or yz plane.
00063 *For arcs in xy plane, simply sweep the cross-section of the tool.
00064 *Despite all the effort put into creating a wire, that really isn't
00065 * useful - the MRSEVs will have to be calculated individually.
00066 *Create a function that will create a 2d outline of an APT tool.
00067 *hard parts: any shape but ball-nose for non-xy-plane cuts
00068 *need to create a cut-segment ABC and subclass it for linear,
00069 * arc, and helical csegs.
00070 */
00071 //doesn't really sweep right now, just displays the wire
00072 
00073 /*
00074 BRepOffsetAPI_MakePipeShell (const TopoDS_Wire &Spine)
00075  ::SetMode (const TopoDS_Wire &AuxiliarySpine, const Standard_Boolean CurvilinearEquivalence, const Standard_Boolean KeepContact=Standard_False)
00076         Sets an auxiliary spine to define the Normal 
00077         --> does this mean what I think it means? If so, project the segment onto an xy plane, use the result as the aux spine.
00078                 --probably wouldn't work well, depends on paramaterization of the projected spine vs that of the original
00079         --> or subclass it and just fix the section as normal to XY
00080 */
00081 void gcode2Model::sweep()
00082 {
00083         bool ready = false;
00084         Handle_AIS_Shape pipeAis;
00085         TopoDS_Wire toolwire = create2dTool(1,0);
00086         TopoDS_Face tool2d = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeFace(gp_Pln(gp::ZOX()),toolwire);
00087 
00088         drawSome(-1);
00089 
00090         //place the tool at the start of the wire and in the correct orientation
00091 /*      gp_Trsf fTrsf;
00092         BRepBuilderAPI_Transform brepTrsf(tool2d , fTrsf);
00093         TopoDS_Shape trsfShape = brepTrsf.Shape();
00094         TopoDS_Face sweepFace = TopoDS::Face(trsfShape);
00095 */
00096         BRepOffsetAPI_MakePipeShell pipe(thePath);
00097         infoMsg("pipe");
00098         pipe.Add(toolwire,false,true);
00099         //pipe.Add(tool2d,false,true);
00100         //pipe.SetTransitionMode()
00101         //pipe.SetMode()
00102         infoMsg("added tool\n");
00103         if ( pipe.IsReady() ) {
00104                 pipe.Build();
00105                 BRepBuilderAPI_PipeError error = pipe.GetStatus();
00106                 switch (error) {
00107                   case BRepBuilderAPI_PipeNotDone:
00108                     infoMsg("Pipe not done");
00109                     break;
00110                   case BRepBuilderAPI_PlaneNotIntersectGuide:
00111                     infoMsg("Pipe not intersect guide");
00112                     break;
00113                   case BRepBuilderAPI_ImpossibleContact:
00114                     infoMsg("Pipe impossible contact");
00115                     break;
00116                   case BRepBuilderAPI_PipeDone:
00117                     ready = true;
00118                     break;
00119                  default:
00120                     infoMsg("Pipe switch default?!");
00121                 }
00122         }
00123         if (ready) {
00124                 pipeAis = new AIS_Shape ( pipe.Shape() );
00125         }else {
00126                 infoMsg("pipe not ready!");
00127                 pipeAis = new AIS_Shape ( tool2d );
00128         }
00129         theWindow->getContext()->SetMaterial ( pipeAis,Graphic3d_NOM_PLASTIC );  //Try GOLD or PLASTER or ...
00130         theWindow->getContext()->SetDisplayMode ( pipeAis,1,Standard_False );  //shaded
00131         theWindow->getContext()->Display ( pipeAis );
00132 }

00171 void gcode2Model::showWire() {
00172         Handle_AIS_Shape feedAis = new AIS_Shape ( thePath );
00173         theWindow->getContext()->SetMaterial ( feedAis,Graphic3d_NOM_PLASTIC );  //Supposed to look like plastic.  Try GOLD or PLASTER or ...
00174         theWindow->getContext()->SetDisplayMode ( feedAis,1,Standard_False );  //shaded
00175         theWindow->getContext()->Display ( feedAis );
00176 }
00177 
00178 bool gcode2Model::drawSome(int j)
00179 {
00180         bool success = false;
00181         if ( j == -1 ) j += feedEdges.size();
00182         if (j < (int)feedEdges.size()) {
00183                 BRepBuilderAPI_MakeWire makeW;
00184                 uint i;
00185                 chkEdgeStruct result;
00186                 for ( i=0 ; (int)i < j ; i++ ) {
00187                         result = checkEdge( feedEdges, i );     //check that edges are connected
00188                         if ((result.startGap == 0.0) && (result.endGap == 0.0))
00189                                 makeW.Add(feedEdges[i].e);
00190                         else return false;
00191                 }
00192                 if (makeW.IsDone()) {
00193                         thePath = makeW.Wire();
00194                         success = true;
00195                 } else {
00196                         cout << "Failed to build wire of length " << j << endl;
00197                         if ( j > 1 ) {
00198                                 cout << "last edge: " << toString(feedEdges[i-1].start).toStdString() << " to ";
00199                                 cout << toString(feedEdges[i-1].end).toStdString() << endl;
00200                                 cout << "prev edge: " << toString(feedEdges[i-2].start).toStdString() << " to ";
00201                                 cout << toString(feedEdges[i-2].end).toStdString() << endl;
00202                                 return drawSome (j-1);
00203                         }
00204                 }
00205         } else {
00206                 cout << "past end of feedEdges: index " << j << " is too big for count " << feedEdges.size() << endl;
00207 //              infoMsg(s);
00208         }
00209         return success;
00210 }
00211 
00212 /****************************************************************************
00213 TopoDS_Wire create2dTool(Standard_Real diam, Standard_Real shape)
00214 
00215 Returns a wire that is a cross-section of the described tool, for sweeping along toolpath.
00216 diam is the diameter (units ???)
00217 shape controls the tool's tip as such:
00218   shape==0   ->  ball nose mill
00219   shape>=PI  ->  endmill (square tip) (PI radians is 180 degrees, think of it as flat)
00220   0<shape<PI ->  engraving tool, value is the included angle in RADIANS
00221 
00222 Wire that is returned MUST be on the XZ plane, symmeteric about Z, center of the tooltip at the origin, rest of the tool above (+Z) the origin
00223 ******************************************************************************/
00224 TopoDS_Wire gcode2Model::create2dTool ( Standard_Real diam, Standard_Real shape ) 
00225 {
00226         TopoDS_Wire tool2d;
00227 
00228         if (shape==0) { //ballnose mill -- need arc, 3 lines
00229                 //puts("ball tool");
00230                 Handle(Geom_TrimmedCurve) Tc = GC_MakeArcOfCircle (gp_Pnt(diam/2,0,diam/2), gp_Pnt(0,0,0), gp_Pnt(-diam/2,0,diam/2));
00231                 TopoDS_Edge Ec = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(Tc);  //convert the curve from geometry to topology
00232                 TopoDS_Edge E1 = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(diam/2,0,diam/2), gp_Pnt(diam/2,0,diam*10));
00233                 TopoDS_Edge E2 = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(-diam/2,0,diam/2), gp_Pnt(-diam/2,0,diam*10));
00234                 TopoDS_Edge E3 = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(-diam/2,0,diam*10), gp_Pnt(diam/2,0,diam*10));
00235                 tool2d = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeWire(Ec,E1,E2,E3); //.Wire();
00236         } else if (shape>=PI) { //endmill -- need rectangle
00237                 //puts("endmill");
00238                 TopoDS_Edge E1 = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(diam/2,0,0), gp_Pnt(diam/2,0,diam*10));
00239                 TopoDS_Edge E2 = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(-diam/2,0,0), gp_Pnt(-diam/2,0,diam*10));
00240                 TopoDS_Edge E3 = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(-diam/2,0,0), gp_Pnt(diam/2,0,0));
00241                 TopoDS_Edge E4 = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(diam/2,0,diam*10), gp_Pnt(-diam/2,0,diam*10));
00242                 tool2d = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeWire(E1,E3,E2,E4); //apparently the lines have to be in order or it will silently fail?!
00243 
00244         } else {  //V-tip engraving tool -- need V, 3 more lines.
00245                 //puts("engraving");
00246                 Standard_Real Vz = diam/(2*tan(shape/2)); //Vz is Z height of top of angled part of tip.
00247                 BRepBuilderAPI_MakeWire toolMakeWire;
00248                         //again, wires must be in order, wtf?
00249                 toolMakeWire.Add(BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(0,0,0), gp_Pnt(diam/2,0,Vz)));  
00250                 toolMakeWire.Add(BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(0,0,0), gp_Pnt(-diam/2,0,Vz)));
00251                 toolMakeWire.Add(BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(-diam/2,0,Vz), gp_Pnt(-diam/2,0,diam*10)));
00252                 toolMakeWire.Add(BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(-diam/2,0,diam*10), gp_Pnt(diam/2,0,diam*10)));
00253                 toolMakeWire.Add(BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(gp_Pnt(diam/2,0,Vz), gp_Pnt(diam/2,0,diam*10)));
00254                 tool2d = toolMakeWire.Wire();
00255         }
00256 
00257         return tool2d;
00258 }
00259 
00260 //begin, direction at begin, end
00261 TopoDS_Edge gcode2Model::arc ( gp_Pnt a, gp_Vec V, gp_Pnt b )
00262 {
00263         Handle ( Geom_TrimmedCurve ) Tc = GC_MakeArcOfCircle ( a, V, b );
00264         return BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge ( Tc );
00265 }
00266 
00267 //Create a helix.  Axis MUST be parallel to X, Y, or Z. Create as lines on a cylindrical face (like the makebottle demo)
00268 TopoDS_Edge gcode2Model::helix ( gp_Pnt start, gp_Pnt end, gp_Pnt c, gp_Dir dir, int rot )
00269 {
00270         Standard_Real pU,pV;
00271         Standard_Real radius = start.Distance(c);
00272         gp_Pnt2d p1,p2;
00273         Handle(Geom_CylindricalSurface) cyl = new Geom_CylindricalSurface(gp_Ax2(c,dir) , radius);
00274         GeomAPI_ProjectPointOnSurf proj;
00275         TopoDS_Edge h;
00276         int success = 0;
00277         
00278         h.Nullify();
00279         //cout << "Radius " << radius << "   Rot has the value " << rot << endl;
00280         proj.Init(start,cyl);
00281         if(proj.NbPoints() > 0) {
00282                 proj.LowerDistanceParameters(pU, pV);
00283                 if(proj.LowerDistance() > 1.0e-6 ) {
00284                         //cout << "Point fitting distance " << double(proj.LowerDistance()) << endl;
00285                 }
00286                 success++;
00287                 p1 = gp_Pnt2d(pU,pV);
00288         }
00289         
00290         proj.Init(end,cyl);
00291         if(proj.NbPoints() > 0) {
00292                 proj.LowerDistanceParameters(pU, pV);
00293                 if(proj.LowerDistance() > 1.0e-6 ) {
00294                         //cout << "Point fitting distance " << double(proj.LowerDistance()) << endl;
00295                 }
00296                 success++;
00297                 p2 = gp_Pnt2d(pU,pV);
00298         }
00299         
00300         if (success != 2) {
00301           cout << "Couldn't create a helix from " << toString(start).toStdString() << " to " << toString(end).toStdString() << ". Replacing with a line." <<endl;
00302           h = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge( start, end );
00303           return h;
00304         }
00305 
00306         //for the 2d points, x axis is about the circumference.  Units are radians.
00307         //change direction if rot = 1, not if rot = -1
00308         //if (rot==1) p2.SetX((p1.X()-p2.X())-2*M_PI); << this is wrong!
00309         //cout << "p1x " << p1.X() << ", p2x " << p2.X() << endl;
00310 
00311         //switch direction if necessary, only works for simple cases
00312         //should always work for G02/G03 because they are less than 1 rotation
00313         if (rot==1) {
00314           p2.SetX(p2.X()-2*M_PI);
00315           //cout << "p2x now " << p2.X() << endl;
00316         }
00317         Handle(Geom2d_TrimmedCurve) segment = GCE2d_MakeSegment(p1 , p2);
00318         h = BRepBuilderAPI_MakeEdge(segment , cyl);
00319         
00320         return h;
00321 }
00322 
00323 //returns a structure containing info on the start and end of the edge
00324 gcode2Model::chkEdgeStruct gcode2Model::checkEdge( std::vector<myEdgeType> edges, uint n )
00325 {
00326   chkEdgeStruct eStruct;
00327   eStruct.startGap = 0.0;
00328   eStruct.endGap = 0.0;
00329   //if (n < 1) return eStruct;
00330   double d = 0;
00331   gp_Pnt p;
00332   bool nogap = true;
00333   /* 
00334   ** should not need to check this, start should always be 
00335   ** assigned the value of the previus end.
00336   d = edges[n].start.Distance(edges[n-1].end);
00337   if (d > Precision::Confusion()) {
00338     cout << "Found gap of " << d << " before edge " << n << endl;
00339     nogap = false;
00340   }
00341   */
00342   
00343   p = BRep_Tool::Pnt(TopExp::FirstVertex(edges[n].e));
00344   d = edges[n].start.Distance(p);
00345   if (d > Precision::Confusion()) {
00346     cout << "Start data differs by " << d << " before edge " << n << " - expected: ";
00347     cout << toString(feedEdges[n].start).toStdString();
00348     cout << " - actual: " << toString(p).toStdString() << endl;
00349     nogap = false;
00350     eStruct.startGap = d;
00351     eStruct.realStart = p;
00352   }
00353   
00354   p = BRep_Tool::Pnt(TopExp::LastVertex(edges[n].e));
00355   d = edges[n].end.Distance(p);
00356   if (d > Precision::Confusion()) {
00357     //nogap = false;
00358     eStruct.endGap = d;
00359     eStruct.realEnd = p;
00360   }
00361   //stay silent unless the error is relatively large:
00362   // 1/100,000 inch or 1 nanometer depending on units (inch vs mm)
00363   if (d > 100.0*Precision::Confusion()) { 
00364     nogap = false;
00365     cout << "End data differs by " << d << " after edge " << n << " - expected: ";
00366     cout << toString(feedEdges[n].end).toStdString();
00367     cout << " - actual: " << toString(p).toStdString() << endl;
00368   }  
00369   
00370   if (!nogap) {
00371     if (edges[n].shape == HELIX) {
00372         cout << "Failure is on a helix";
00373     } else if (edges[n].shape == ARC) {
00374         cout << "Failure is on an arc";
00375     } else if ((edges[n].shape == LINE) && (edges[n].motion == TRAVERSE )) {
00376         cout << "Failure is on a rapid traverse";
00377     } else if ((edges[n].shape == LINE) && (edges[n].motion == FEED )) {
00378         cout << "Failure is on a linear move";
00379     } else cout << "Failure is on a move of undefined type!" << endl; //should never get here
00380   }
00381   return eStruct;
00382 }
